gurmukhi: ਭੇਟ ਭੁਜਾ ਕਰ ਅੰਕ ਭਲੇ ਭਰਿ ਨੈਨ ਦੋੳੂ ਨਿਰਖੇ ਰਘੁਰਾੲੀ ॥
transliteration: Bhet Bhujaa Kar Ank Bhale Bhar(i) Nain Dooo Nirkhe Raghuraaee||
translation: With tears of joy in both his eyes and meeting affectionately with his people Ram entered Ayodhya.

gurmukhi: ਗੁੰਜਤ ਭ੍ਰਿੰਗ ਕਪੋਲਨ ੳੂਪਰ ਨਾਗ ਲਵੰਗ ਰਹੇ ਲਿਵ ਲਾੲੀ ॥
transliteration: Gounjat Bhring Kapolan Oopar Naag Lavan Rahe Liv Laaee||
translation: The black bees were humming on the cheeks and the braids of long hair of Sita were hanging like the Nagas looking towards her face.

gurmukhi: ਕੰਜ ਕੁਰੰਗ ਕਲਾ ਨਿਧ ਕੇਹਰਿ ਕੋਕਲ ਹੇਰ ਹੀੲੇ ਹਹਰਾੲੀ ॥
transliteration: Kanj Kuran Kalaa Nidh Kehar(i) Kokal Her Heee Hahraaee||
translation: The lotus, deer, moon, lioness and nightingale were perplexed in their minds and seeing her (eyes, agility, beauty, courage and sweet voice respectively).

gurmukhi: ਬਾਲ ਲਖੈਂ ਛਬ ਖਾਟ ਪਰੈਂ ਨਹਿ ਬਾਟ ਚਲੈ ਨਿਰਖੇ ਅਧਿਕਾੲੀ ॥੧੫੪॥
transliteration: Baal Lakhain Chhab Khaat Darain Nah(i) Baat Nah(i) Baat Chhalai Nirkhe Adhikaaee||154||
translation: The children, seeing her beauty, also were falling unconscious and the travelers abandoning their path, were looking at her.154.

gurmukhi: ਸੀਅ ਰਹੀ ਮੁਰਛਾੲਿ ਮਨੈ ਰਨ ਰਾਮ ਕਹਾ ਮਨ ਬਾਤ ਧਰੈਂਗੇ ॥
transliteration: Seea Rahimurchhaad Mania Ran Raam Kahaa Man Baat Ddarainge||
translation: Sita was getting worried on reflecting whether Ram will agree with her sayings or not;

gurmukhi: ਤੋਰ ਸਰਾਸਨਿ ਸੰਕਰ ਕੋ ਜਿਮ ਮੋਹਿ ਬਰਿਓ ਤਿਮ ਅੳੁਰ ਬਰੈਂਗੇ ॥
transliteration: Tor Saraasan(i) Sankar Ko Jim Moh(i) Barrio Tim Aur Darainge||
translation: And also whether it can happen that Ram may wed another woman like wedding me on breaking the bow of Shiva.

gurmukhi: ਦੂਸਰ ਬਯਾਹ ਬਧੂ ਅਬ ਹੀ ਮਨ ਤੇ ਮੁਹਿ ਨਾਥ ਬਿਸਾਰ ਡਰੈਂਗੇ ॥
transliteration: Doosar Byaah Badhoo Ab Himan Te Muh(i) Naath Bisaar Darainge||
translation: If he thinks another marriage in his mind, then her Lord on forgetting her, will fill her life definitely with unrest.

gurmukhi: ਦੇਖਤ ਹੌ ਨਿਜ ਭਾਗ ਭਲੇ ਬਿਧ ਅਾਜ ਕਹਾ ੲਿਹ ਠੌਰ ਕਰੈਂਗੇ ॥੧੫੫॥
transliteration: Dekhat Hau Nij Bhaag Bhale Bidh Aaj Kahaa Ih Thaur Darainge||155||
translation: Let us see that is recorded in my fate and what he will do in future?155.

gurmukhi: ਤੳੁ ਹੀ ਲੳੁ ਰਾਮ ਜਿਤੇ ਦਿਜ ਕੳੁ ਅਪਨੇ ਦਲ ਅਾੲਿ ਬਜਾੲਿ ਬਧਾੲੀ ॥
transliteration: Tau Hilau Raam Jite Dij Kau Apne Dal Aae Bajaae Badhaaee||
translation: At that same time, the groups of Brahmins came forward and began and thither in joy.

gurmukhi: ਭੱਗੁਲ ਲੋਕ ਫਿਰੈ ਸਭ ਹੀ ਰਣ ਮੋ ਲਖ ਰਾਘਵ ਕੀ ਅਧਕਾੲੀ ॥
transliteration: Bhaggul Lok Phirai Sabh Hiran Mo Lakh Raaghav Kiadhkaaee||
translation: Hearing about the victory of Ram in the war, all the people ran hither and thither in joy.

gurmukhi: ਸੀਅ ਰਹੀ ਰਨ ਰਾਮ ਜਿਤੇ ਅਵਧੇਸਰ ਬਾਤ ਜਬੈ ਸੁਨਿ ਪਾੲੀ ॥
transliteration: Seea Rahiran Raam Jite Avadhesar Baat Jabai Soun(i) Paaee||
translation: When Dasrath came to know that after conquering Sita, Ram has also conquered the war,

gurmukhi: ਫੂਲਿ ਗਧੋ ਅਤਿ ਹੀ ਮਨ ਮੈ ਧਨ ਕੇ ਘਨ ਕੀ ਬਰਖਾ ਬਰਖਾੲੀ ॥੧੫੬॥
transliteration: Phool(i) Gado At(i) Himan Mai Dhan Ke Ghan Kibarkhaa Barkhaaee||156||
translation: Then his delight knew no bounds and he showered the wealth like the rain of clouds.156.

gurmukhi: ਬੰਦਨਵਾਰ ਬਧੀ ਸਭ ਹੀ ਦਰ ਚੰਦਨ ਸੌ ਛਿਰਕੇ ਗ੍ਹ ਸਾਰੇ ॥
transliteration: Bandanvaar Badhisabh Hidar Channdan Sau Chhirke Grah Sdare||
translation: The doors of all the subjects were bedecked with greetings and the sandalwood was sprinkled over all the houses.

gurmukhi: ਕੇਸਰ ਡਾਰਿ ਬਰਾਤਨ ਪੈ ਸਭ ਹੀ ਜਨ ਹੁੲਿ ਪੁਰਹੂਤ ਪਧਾਰੇ ॥
transliteration: Kesar Daar(i) Baraatan Pai Sabh Hijan Hue Purhoot Padhdare||
translation: Saffron was sprinkled over all the companions (of Ram) and it seemed that Indra was entering his city.
